column4: hey, if apt-get update doesn't like the online sources, what should I do?
bur[n] er, I've tried several times..
the default ones don't work right
put your sources.list up on the pastebin (i.e., not here)
you need main and restricted too
the second link in what ubotu has sent you has an example 'sources.list' file which you can use
I'm getting a bunch of 302 Moved errors..
i'm browsing archive.ubuntu.com fine; let me try the Release and Packages.gz files
can you browse this url http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/hoary/Release in firefox?
I'm unable to bring up graphics mode
you can maybe use the http_proxy variable to specify a web-proxy to use; you may even be able to add a username password to the url (I can't remember the syntax)
if it's a windows-only proxy, you can install ntlmaps (download the .deb, and use dpkg to install it)
it's not what I would call a proxy really..
